basic_info.description: After an initial career in the social and healthcare sector, I decided to follow my passion for coding and web development. A graduate of OpenClassrooms in 2022, I am a junior developer eager to channel my creativity and thirst for learning into assets for businesses and clients. I have a strong foundation in both front-end and back-end technologies, which I strive to improve daily while acquiring new skills. With my energy, teamwork experience, and curiosity, I am ready to take on exciting challenges. Outside of development, I am also a musician and athlete, which enhances my discipline and initiative. Currently seeking my first position in web development, I am highly motivated to learn, grow, and contribute to ambitious projects. Based in Caen, I would be delighted to discuss how I can support your needs. You can find more information on my LinkedIn page. Feel free to get in touch!

projects.title: Mon vieux grimoire
projects.description: My first real experience in back-end development. I used Node.js with the Express framework to deploy a database and set up a REST API. The result: a book rating website where users can log in, add books, and rate them. To achieve this, the project had to be organized in a modular way, especially the various middleware components. Adhering to Green Code principles was also central to this project, requiring special attention to resource management, such as storing images and saving them in the database. The use of Mongoose was a key aspect in managing MongoDB, particularly in designing consistent database models. Collaboration with other OpenClassrooms students helped us overcome several challenges, such as managing the Multer middleware and handling images.

projects.title: Kasa
projects.description: My first experience with React. I was able to leverage my JavaScript skills to develop the front-end of a rental website and implement the router. I also learned how to create CSS animations and use SASS syntax. The modular logic of React was the main challenge of this project, as each component needed to be reusable and every site feature as modular as possible while maintaining project clarity, which was optimized with the help of my mentor. Transitioning from a CSS logic to a SASS-based approach led to some styling issues as I worked to understand its functionality.

projects.title: Nina Carducci
projects.description: The goal here was to optimize a photographer's website to improve its SEO and make it more accessible to all audiences. This involved fixing and optimizing the code, enhancing local SEO with Schema.org, and applying accessibility best practices to achieve a green Lighthouse audit.
